source: put your shoulder to the wheel
lemma: put one's shoulder to the wheel
definitions: To work hard and make a concerted effort towards a common goal.
To apply oneself with great effort and determination to a task.
examples: If we all put our shoulder to the wheel, we can finish this project ahead of schedule.
It's time to put your shoulder to the wheel and get this done.
The team needed to put their shoulder to the wheel to meet the deadline.
